item.title: Water flowing out of field, 14th February
item.description:
Water is flowing out of the field onto and flooding the road around the junction and up dog lane before flowing into a ditch. Will be lethal on this corner when it freezes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Long line of deep potholes, 14th February
item.description:
Much worse than photos which were taken before Christmas. Line of deep potholes and road surface broken around holes … getting worse daily

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Illuminated bollards are missing on The Park, 14th February
item.description:
On The Park, in Cheltenham, near the junction with St Stephen’s Road the bollards have been missing for several weeks. Residents are concerned about the danger this poses in the evenings and at night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Lodge Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Rattling manhole cover plus tarman sinking, 14th February
item.description:
Outside No. 18 Charlton Lane. Rattling is getting worse as heavy vehicles drive over it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Charlton Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road has not been swept fo at least a year. Grass is growing in the debtis. This is the main reason why the drains keep blocking and causing flooding every time it rains. Pedestrians are getting drenched by vehicles as they drive through the floods and there is no way to get out of the way., 14th February

item.title: This drain has sunken an poses a risk especially to cyclists. It is also blocked an has been for a long time. I noticed 2 other reports on this and these have been closed wit no apparent action taken or explanation why not., 14th February

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 14th February
item.description:
Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Bags left on Cheltenham Road, Longlevens opposite Pearman Briggs Caravans. Next to dog waste bin 0273.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
